snippet: The de Blasio administration began soliciting proposals for the last development within Brooklyn Bridge Park, but some residents and officials criticized the decision.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio's administration begins soliciting proposals for the last development within Brooklyn Bridge Park, two towers with a mix of luxury apartments and, in a new twist, units affordable to firefighters, nurses and construction workers; administration and park officials say the development will generate money to maintain the waterfront park and provide badly needed affordable housing.
lead_paragraph: The de Blasio administration began soliciting proposals for the last development within Brooklyn Bridge Park, but some residents and officials criticized the decision.

headline.main: Brooklyn Development Plan Stirs Debates on Affordable Housing and Park Funding
headline.print_headline: Brooklyn Development Plan Stirs Debates on Affordable Housing and Park Funding
